background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.

我们的目标是将热带低频波动（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响置于重点，特别关注热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动力特征及其在改善季节到季节预测（S2S）中的重要性。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测数据（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的T2m异常，数据来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气再分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表面温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau（TP）调制一个持久的准气压波动——青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从TP经东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部，以及春季从TP横跨整个北太平洋盆地的西风急流。由TP热异常调制的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，TP的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的首要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波动列车在TP的表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波动列车影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，随着强西风急流穿过亚太地区的外热带，TP表面降温产生了一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（在时间尺度上超过一个月）TRC波动列车，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常（如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜）的联系已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能会影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米空气温度（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但它们在陆气相互作用研究中的应用，特别是在S2S预测中，仍然被大大忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一个社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是研究观察到的2003年5月青藏高原异常低温是否导致了全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这种缺陷会导致对热带地区（TP）T2m效应的低估吗？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他涉及的过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用了16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when using Earth System Models (ESMs) to predict subseasonal-to-seasonal climate variability?
Example.QuestionCn: 使用地球系统模型（ESMs）预测亚季节到季节气候变率时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced when using ESMs is that they often do not fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Example.AnswerCn: 使用地球系统模型（ESMs）时面临的一个挑战是，由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的缺陷，它们往往无法完全保留初始化的陆面温度异常的记忆。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'ensemble mean' refer to in the context of climate model simulations?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候模型模拟的上下文中，“ensemble mean”指的是多个气候模型模拟结果的平均值。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of climate model simulations, 'ensemble mean' refers to the average result obtained from running multiple climate model simulations, often with slightly different initial conditions or configurations. This approach aims to account for uncertainties and variability in model outputs by averaging across different model outcomes to provide a more robust estimate of expected climate behaviors or patterns.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气候模型模拟的背景下，“集合均值”是指通过运行多个气候模型模拟（通常具有略微不同的初始条件或配置）所获得的平均结果。这种方法旨在通过对不同模型结果进行平均，以考虑模型输出中的不确定性和变异性，从而提供对预期气候行为或模式的更稳健估计。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges in initializing land surface temperature (LST) models differ from those in initializing sea surface temperature (SST) models for subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) climate predictions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在初始化陆面温度（LST）模型与初始化海面温度（SST）模型用于亚季节到季节（S2S）气候预测时，面临的挑战有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Initializing LST models for S2S predictions involves dealing with the significant variability of land attributes like soil moisture and vegetation, which can lead to imbalances in the initial atmospheric/land conditions. SST models benefit from more homogeneous conditions and well-established observational networks, but the influence of ocean currents and subsurface temperatures adds complexity. Both face issues with parameterizations and data assimilation but differ in the types of environmental variables that need to be accurately modeled.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 初始化陆地-气候（LST）模型进行季节到季节的预测时，需要处理土壤湿度和植被等土地属性的显著变异性，这可能导致初始大气/土地条件的不平衡。海表温度（SST）模型受益于更均匀的条件和成熟的观测网络，但海洋洋流和地下温度的影响增加了复杂性。两者都面临参数化和数据同化的问题，但在需要准确建模的环境变量类型上存在差异。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences between datasets used for analyzing atmospheric circulation responses to land temperature anomalies and those used for ocean temperature anomalies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 用于分析大气环流对陆地温度异常响应的数据集与用于海洋温度异常的数据集之间的相似性和差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets used for analyzing atmospheric circulation responses to land temperature anomalies, such as the ERA5 reanalysis and CAMS T2m data, focus on surface and atmospheric variables over land. Those for ocean temperature anomalies, like satellite SST data, emphasize sea surface observations and ocean-atmosphere interactions. Both types of datasets are used to study teleconnections and climate variability, but they differ in their primary focus areas and the sources of their data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 用于分析陆地温度异常对大气环流响应的数据集，如ERA5再分析和CAMS T2m数据，主要关注陆地上的表面和大气变量。而用于海洋温度异常的数据集，如卫星海表温度（SST）数据，则强调海表观测和海洋-大气相互作用。这两类数据集都用于研究遥相关和气候变异，但它们在主要关注领域和数据来源上有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do different data collection methods impact the accuracy and reliability of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同的数据收集方法如何影响亚季节到季节降水预测的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Data collection methods, such as the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions, significantly impact the accuracy of precipitation predictions. The integration of high-resolution observational datasets, like those from the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ERA5 reanalysis, enhances the representation of surface temperature anomalies. However, challenges remain in preserving the memory of initialized anomalies due to model deficiencies, which can lead to discrepancies between observed and predicted outcomes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法，如地表温度和雪盖条件的初始化，显著影响降水预测的准确性。整合高分辨率观测数据集，如气候异常监测系统和ERA5再分析，增强了对地表温度异常的表征。然而，由于模型缺陷，保持初始化异常的记忆仍然面临挑战，这可能导致观测结果与预测结果之间的差异。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the significant errors in current global land-atmosphere coupled models when producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型在生成观察到的青藏高原表面温度时，导致显著误差的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature (LST) anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么从青藏 Plateau 到南半球的模拟传播路径会显示出较大的模型间差异？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models, resulting in large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 未能捕捉到TRC波列的参与模型在参考观测和成功模型时大大低估了气候异常，导致模拟传播路径的模型间差异很大。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced in robust land initialization and model configuration for predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation events?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在预测亚季节到季节（S2S）降水事件时，稳健的土地初始化和模型配置面临的挑战有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration remain scientifically challenging due to a lack of observational data and the tendency to focus on local feedbacks, limiting the understanding of land-atmosphere interactions and the ability of models to preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置仍然是科学上具有挑战性的任务，这主要是由于观测数据的缺乏以及倾向于关注局部反馈，限制了对陆地-大气相互作用的理解以及模型保持初始化的地表温度异常记忆的能力。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What is the impact of using initialized land temperature and snowpack data on subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy and how does it influence the predictability of precipitation events?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用初始化的陆地温度和雪盖数据对亚季节到季节预测的准确性有何影响，以及它如何影响降水事件的可预测性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of initialized land temperature and snowpack data, particularly over high mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau, significantly influences the predictability of precipitation events by providing a new source of subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy. The LS4P project reveals that high-mountain land temperatures can be a substantial source of predictability, potentially on par with ocean surface temperatures, by improving the simulation of temperature and precipitation anomalies in global 'hotspot' regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 初始化的陆地温度和雪盖数据的使用，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区，显著影响了降水事件的可预测性，通过提供新的亚季节到季节预测准确性来源。LS4P项目揭示，高山陆地温度可以成为一个重要的可预测性来源，潜力可能与海洋表面温度相当，通过改善全球“热点”地区的温度和降水异常的模拟。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How do inter-model differences in simulating TRC wave trains affect the global atmospheric circulation predictions, and what are the consequences of these differences on climate anomaly forecasts?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 不同模型在模拟热带辐合区（TRC）波列方面的差异如何影响全球大气环流预测，这些差异对气候异常预测的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Inter-model differences in simulating TRC wave trains lead to significant variations in global atmospheric circulation predictions. These differences result in under-predicted climate anomalies compared to observations. The inability of some models to capture the TRC wave train limits their effectiveness in forecasting climate anomalies, particularly in regions affected by these wave trains.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 不同模型在模拟热带罗波（TRC）波列方面的差异导致全球大气环流预测的显著变化。这些差异导致气候异常的预测低于观测值。一些模型无法捕捉到TRC波列，限制了它们在预测气候异常方面的有效性，特别是在受这些波列影响的地区。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using multiple datasets from different sources, like ERA5 and CRU, for understanding the global influence of springtime land surface anomalies on summer precipitation?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用来自不同来源的多个数据集，如ERA5和CRU，来理解春季地表异常对夏季降水的全球影响，可能会产生以下潜在后果：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing multiple datasets from different sources, such as ERA5 for atmospheric circulation and CRU for global precipitation, allows for a comprehensive analysis of the global influence of springtime land surface anomalies on summer precipitation. This approach helps cross-verify findings and enhances the robustness of predictions, although it may introduce complexities related to data consistency and integration.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用来自不同来源的多个数据集，例如ERA5用于大气环流和CRU用于全球降水，可以全面分析春季地表异常对夏季降水的全球影响。这种方法有助于交叉验证发现，并增强预测的稳健性，尽管它可能引入与数据一致性和整合相关的复杂性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific data collection methods are used to assess the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal to seasonal predictions, and how are these methods implemented across different models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于评估地表温度异常对亚季节到季节预测影响的具体数据收集方法有哪些，这些方法在不同模型中的实施方式是怎样的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The methods involve using observed temperature records to examine the relationship between land surface temperature anomalies and global precipitation. This includes conducting experiments with multiple Earth System Models, where initial conditions are adjusted based on observed data to improve model predictions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 这些方法涉及使用观测到的温度记录来研究陆地表面温度异常与全球降水之间的关系。这包括使用多个地球系统模型进行实验，根据观测数据调整初始条件，以改善模型预测。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are initial conditions for land surface and subsurface temperatures prepared and utilized in climate models to improve the predictability of subseasonal to seasonal weather patterns?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 初始条件对于陆地表面和地下温度在气候模型中的准备和利用是如何进行的，以提高亚季节到季节天气模式的可预测性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Initial conditions are prepared by adjusting land surface and subsurface temperature data to address model biases. This involves initializing these temperatures based on observed anomalies and model biases, which are then used in climate models to simulate and predict weather patterns more accurately.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 初始条件通过调整地表和地下温度数据来解决模型偏差。这涉及根据观测到的异常和模型偏差初始化这些温度，然后在气候模型中使用这些温度，以更准确地模拟和预测天气模式。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to integrate various observational datasets, such as those from NOAA, ECMWF, and CRU, into climate models for evaluating atmospheric circulation responses?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 将来自NOAA、ECMWF和CRU等不同观测数据集整合到气候模型中，以评估大气环流响应的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To integrate observational datasets into climate models, data from sources like NOAA, ECMWF, and CRU are used to investigate atmospheric circulation. These datasets provide temperature and precipitation data at specific resolutions, which are used to evaluate and compare model simulations with observed atmospheric responses.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了将观测数据集整合到气候模型中，使用来自NOAA、ECMWF和CRU等来源的数据来研究大气环流。这些数据集提供特定分辨率的温度和降水数据，用于评估和比较模型模拟与观测到的大气响应。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the integration of land surface and subsurface temperature data for subseasonal to seasonal prediction in climate models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论能够将地表和地下温度数据整合到气候模型的亚季节到季节预测中？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of land surface and subsurface temperature data is enabled by initializing the LST/SUBT over high mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, which involves adjusting initial conditions based on model biases and observed anomalies. This approach helps in enhancing the accuracy of climate model predictions by improving the representation of land temperature effects on global atmospheric circulation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过在高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）初始化地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT），实现了地表和地下温度数据的整合。这涉及根据模型偏差和观测异常调整初始条件。这种方法有助于提高气候模型预测的准确性，改善地表温度对全球大气环流影响的表征。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack not lead to expected improvements in subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么地表温度和雪盖的初始化可能不会导致对季节内到季节性降水预测的预期改善？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical yet remain scientifically challenging. Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置至关重要，但仍然面临科学挑战。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might current datasets not adequately capture the influence of the Tibetan Plateau's surface temperature on global atmospheric circulations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前的数据集可能无法充分捕捉到青藏高原表面温度对全球大气环流的影响，原因可能包括以下几点：
Expectation.AnswerEn: One reason is that the ensemble mean of the Earth System Models exhibits a warm bias over the Tibetan Plateau, leading to inaccuracies in capturing observed anomalies. Additionally, there are phase differences between simulated wave trains and observations, which can result in discrepancies between model outputs and real-world data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 一个原因是地球系统模型的集合均值在青藏高原上存在温暖偏差，导致捕捉到的观测异常不准确。此外，模拟的波列与观测之间存在相位差，这可能导致模型输出与实际数据之间的差异。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the perceived challenges in accurately capturing land surface temperature anomalies in high mountain regions, and how might these challenges affect dataset reliability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在高山地区准确捕捉地表温度异常的感知挑战有哪些，这些挑战可能如何影响数据集的可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical yet scientifically challenging. Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) struggle to preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data providing unbalanced initial conditions. This could lead to inaccuracies in capturing the observed anomalies, affecting the dataset's reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 稳健的陆地初始化和模型配置至关重要，但在科学上具有挑战性。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）在保持初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆方面存在困难，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷和提供不平衡初始条件的再分析数据。这可能导致捕捉观测异常的准确性下降，从而影响数据集的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can data collection methods be refined to address the inter-model differences observed in simulated atmospheric responses to temperature anomalies, particularly in Southern Hemisphere pathways?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何改进数据收集方法，以解决在模拟大气对温度异常反应中观察到的模型间差异，特别是在南半球路径方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Refining data collection methods could involve improving the observational data quality and quantity, especially for land temperature and snowpack in high mountain regions. This can help to better initialize models and reduce inter-model differences. Further investigation into the model parameterizations and initial conditions used in ensemble simulations could also help address these differences.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改进数据收集方法可能涉及提高高山地区土地温度和雪盖的观测数据质量和数量。这可以帮助更好地初始化模型并减少模型之间的差异。进一步调查集合模拟中使用的模型参数化和初始条件也可以帮助解决这些差异。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about what makes certain datasets more suitable for studying subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction variability.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定是什么使得某些数据集更适合研究亚季节到季节预测的变异性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets that are suitable for studying S2S prediction variability typically include high-resolution, long-term observational data, such as T2m and precipitation records, which help in understanding past climate behavior and model validation. For instance, datasets like the ERA5 reanalysis and CRU precipitation data provide comprehensive historical climate data that are crucial for simulating and assessing prediction models.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 适合研究季节到季节（S2S）预测变异性的数据库通常包括高分辨率、长期的观测数据，例如气温（T2m）和降水记录，这有助于理解过去的气候行为和模型验证。例如，ERA5再分析数据和CRU降水数据提供了全面的历史气候数据，这对于模拟和评估预测模型至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why there are significant errors in producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures in global models.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么全球模型在产生观察到的青藏高原表面温度时会出现显著误差。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The errors in global models when producing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures are mainly due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions in reanalysis data. This results in an inability to fully capture the observed anomalies, leading to discrepancies between model simulations and actual observations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 全球模型在生成观察到的青藏高原表面温度时的误差主要源于模型参数化的缺陷和再分析数据中大气/陆地初始条件的不平衡。这导致模型无法完全捕捉到观察到的异常，从而造成模型模拟与实际观测之间的差异。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential data collection methods that could enhance the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas for subseasonal to seasonal climate prediction models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨潜在的数据收集方法，以增强高山地区地表和地下温度异常的初始化，为亚季节到季节气候预测模型提供支持。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection methods could include utilizing observational data from meteorological stations, such as those provided by the Chinese Meteorological Administration, as well as integrating reanalysis datasets like ERA5 to improve the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies. Adjusting initial conditions based on observed biases can also be beneficial.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法可以包括利用气象站的观测数据，例如中国气象局提供的数据，以及整合重分析数据集如ERA5，以改善地表和地下温度异常的初始化。根据观测偏差调整初始条件也可以是有益的。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in using current Earth System Models for capturing the Tibetan Plateau's influence on global atmospheric circulation and suggest possible solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析当前地球系统模型在捕捉青藏 Plateau 对全球大气环流影响时面临的挑战，并提出可能的解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include inter-model differences in simulating the propagation pathways of atmospheric anomalies and the inability to fully preserve memory from initialized anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations. Solutions could involve improving land initialization techniques, utilizing more accurate reanalysis data, and enhancing model configurations to better capture these influences.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型之间在模拟大气异常传播路径方面的差异，以及由于模型参数化的缺陷而无法完全保留初始化异常的记忆。解决方案可能包括改进陆地初始化技术，利用更准确的再分析数据，以及增强模型配置以更好地捕捉这些影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose a strategy for expanding datasets that could improve the understanding of land surface temperature impacts on subseasonal to seasonal precipitation predictions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出一个扩展数据集的策略，以改善对地表温度对季节内到季节性降水预测影响的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A strategy could involve integrating multiple sources of observational data, such as expanding the use of high-resolution datasets from the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and the Climate Research Unit, alongside current reanalysis products. Collaborating with international meteorological agencies to incorporate additional station data from underrepresented regions could further enrich the dataset.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一种策略可以包括整合多个观测数据源，例如扩大使用气候异常监测系统和气候研究单位的高分辨率数据集，以及当前的再分析产品。与国际气象机构合作，纳入来自代表性不足地区的额外气象站数据，可以进一步丰富数据集。
